reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I sit here at the airport on my way home from Las Brisas , I am already planning my next visit in my mind. I could sum up Las Brisas in one word, PERFECTO! My wife and I stayed in casita # 504, a Jr. suite, just steps from the Sunset Bar and could not have been happier. Between the bay and lush landscaping, the view was magnificent. Definitely the casitas nearer the top of the mountain are more desirable. The best feature of our casita was, without a doubt, the almost absolute privacy. The only prying eyes are of the squirrels and, at night, a raccoon-like critter. Do not leave your food unattended or it may very well get snatched! Insects were not a problem although we did leave towels on the floor outside the bedroom door at night at the suggestion of a former guest- probably wasn’t necessary. The pool was big and the surrounding deck was huge and included a large, comfy, shaded lounge area. Each day the pool man put fresh flowers in the water.The service from the entire staff was impeccable. Any requests were answered promptly and very courteously. While we never had dinner at the Bella Vista, we had breakfast there, and it was very good with a beautiful view, naturally. Because we hated to leave our casita, we ordered in lunch several times. The turkey sandwich is really good, as was most everything we ate. The banana daiquiris are heaven! In the evenings we called up our driver, Julio Cesar, a very reliable and friendly man, (044) 744 160 08 95. Highly recommend using his services, very fair prices and great guy. We ate dinner at Kookaburra and Baikal, both have great food and lovely atmosphere Do not eat at La Perla by the cliff divers. Not a nice area or atmosphere. Also, for $80 with out drinks the food was okay at best. To sum up you don’t need to look for any other hotel. Thank you Las Brisas.
reviews.title: Las Brisas is Perfecto!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a great three day stay at this wonderful hotel. We were in the beach club casitas #467. I would highly recommend staying up here because nobody looks down on your casita. We toured quite a few other casitas and there were only two that I would rather stay in. One was #469 which was a master suite and had a indoor/outdoor pool. It had pretty much the same view for $1000 more a night. Then there is #510 which is a two bedroom suite. This unit has an indoor jacuzzi and is set on two levels for$1500 a night. We paid less than $200 for #467 and were extremely happy. Make sure you get down to the beach club for a swim and lunch. It is set in such a fantastic setting.
reviews.title: Little slice of heaven
Loved the Private Salt Water Pool
reviews.text: We will for sure be back to visit this little slice of heaven in the future!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Las Brisas is the best thing Acapulco has to offer.
reviews.title: Las Brisas is the place to go for quiet and seclusion for lovers only

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side:
reviews.title: wonderful...but

likes.disliked: — Service At The Bella Vista Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went 2 times there during winter holidays, first time in a standard room with private pool n°245, the room was normal but the pool was beautiful, second time we moved to a junior suite on the top of the hill with a breathtaking view, the room was marvelous, clean, spacious, the staff friendly, everything was perfect.
reviews.title: fantastic place

likes.disliked: — spend a few money more and upgrade the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an amazing private place. We had a casita with a beautiful view of Acapulco Bay and our own private pool. A light, but tasty, breakfast was delivered each morning without interruption. The on-site restaurant was wonderful. A bar was set up outside each evening for sunset. A private club that you could get to by shuttle had wonderful pools and restaurants. The staff was very attentive to our every need. We didn't feel like we ever needed to leave the property.
reviews.title: Wonderful Peace and Quiet

reviews.text: We stayed at Las Brisas over the long Thanksgiving weekend and overall were pleased with our stay. Though most people have commented that they stayed in the Beach Casitas, since we were traveling with another couple we opted to stay in a regular room. Though we booked through Expedia we called the hotel and asked them to put us into 2 rooms that shared a pool and were the only 2 rooms that shared a pool. This request was happily accommodated.
reviews.title: Las Brisas - very relaxing

reviews.text: The room was larger than expected. The style was a bit out-dated, but well maintained. Though the rooms were kept clean, we did have a couple of unpleasant encounters with cockroaches. That said, for us, the view from our balcony, the private pool, and the general privacy and good service made up for it and made our stay a good one.
reviews.title: hotel is good ...dont ever use expedia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because we had our own pool just steps outside our room, we didn't stray from it for too long. We did go down to the ocean beach club one day and it was large with plenty of open lounge chairs. We had lunch in the beach restaurant which was expensive and good, but not great. In general we found the food in the restaurants on site was expensive and because it was "good" not "great" we chose to mostly eat in town.
reviews.title: Las Brisas Acapulco-- Better Than Ever 23 Years Later

reviews.text: If excitement, nightlife, and a bargain is what you are looking, for than Las Brisas is not for you. If you are looking for relaxation, romance, and privacy, than book your trip today because you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Las Brisas...Total Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were guests at Las Brisas Feb 7-14 and brought our 10 year old Son. When we arrived at the airport, we were hustled by the taxi drivers and paid too much to be taken to the resort. Ask the price before you get into that taxi and you should pay between $20-$25US at the most for the ride.
reviews.title: PERFECTO!!!

reviews.text: Only having seen small photos on the various travel sites, we had no idea of its' remote location or unique arrangement. It is located in a residential area up in the hills and away from the bustling "Hotel Zone". You are literelly chauffered, by jeep, from your private Casita everywhere you want to go which took a little getting used to. You are welcome to walk, but unless you enjoy hiking uphill and downhill each way on a winding road in the heat and humidity, you will quickly get used to, and appreciate, the service.
reviews.title: Beautiful views & casitas, but there were some problems.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views from the Casitas are like picture-perfect postcards looking down into Acapulco Bay. At night, it is a blanket of twinkling lights that is spectacular and captivating. The rooms themselves are spacious and airy, with crank-shutters on the doors and windows. They are a bit dated, but add to the overall charm of the resort. Each morning, they drop off a basket of sweet rolls & fresh fruit, and a carafe of coffee in a "magic box" which is a two-way door that they access from outside. It's a great way to start off the day with a bite to eat.
reviews.title: Beautiful location...but
Frozen In Time
reviews.text: We spent a lot of time at their Private Beach Club and loved it! You are taken there by van and it is exclusively for resort guests. My Son and Husband loved diving off the board into the fresh-salt water lagoon (full of fresh fish and crabs!) as well as playing catch with a football in the spacious pool with the swim-up bar. We ordered lunch at the pool and, while pricey, it was both delicious and convenient. I think what we enjoyed most was meeting some of the friendliest and most interesting people from all over the Country. Interestingly, the majority of them had been vacationing at Las Brisas for many years and one couple since the 50's! That said a lot to us about how once you stay there, you will not stay anywhere else, and we agree!

reviews.title: Hotel Las Brisas is a beautiful, romantic retreat!
reviews.text: We spent 5 wonderful nights at Las Brisas for our 25th wedding anniversary in December. We could not have chosen a more romantic setting! The privacy, the mesmerizing view and the first class service made our stay in Acapulco one we will never forget.

reviews.title: Died and gone to heaven!
reviews.text: We booked a beach club casita and were originally placed in casita #443. It was very lovely and the room, terrace, and pool were very large. However, the casitas in the el fuerte section at the top of the hill could look down on part of our terrace, so we moved to casita #467 at the top of the hill where we enjoyed total privacy. The entrance to el fuerte is graced with a beautiful stand of palm trees and a fountain. The casitas have all been renovated with comfortable beds and linens, new doors and shutters, and marble/stone bathrooms with a skylight ceiling over the shower that looks up to the swaying palm branches above. We had a spectacular sweeping view of the bay all the way out to the ocean. The city lights twinkling over the bay at night were so beautiful it was hard to tear your eyes away!

reviews.title: Rest & Relaxation Comes at a price!
reviews.text: Don't miss the sunset bar for sunset and La Concha Beach Club is also a great place to spend the day, however it could use a bit of renovation. We only ordered room service once and it was very tasty and service was prompt. We were dissappointed in our dinner at Bella Vista Restaurant. The setting is hard to beat, but the food wasn't that good, especially not for the price! There are so many good restaurants to choose from in Acapulco that I would say skip this one.

reviews.title: Great time!
reviews.text: Acapulco is a bustling city that never sleeps, so we were grateful to have the perfect balance of activity with the serenity of this beautiful, quiet , private retreat after spending time out among the crowds.

reviews.title: Horrible service at Bellavista Restaurant
reviews.text: If you stay here, spend the extra for a Beach Club Casita. Plan on spending money on taxi fare, and stop by walmart to stock up on beverages and snacks for your room. If you are "coffee snobs" as we are, you may be dissappointed in the coffee brought to your casita's magic box. There isn't a coffee maker in the room, so if you bring your own coffee you would also need to bring some way to make it. We didn't need the insect repellent we bought, but I'm sure the need varies depending on the time of year.
